00025 /*! \file pointing.h
00026  *  Class representing a direction in 3D space
00027  *
00028  *  Copyright (C) 2003-2010 Max-Planck-Society
00029  *  \author Martin Reinecke
00030  */
00031 
00032 #ifndef PLANCK_POINTING_H
00033 #define PLANCK_POINTING_H
00034 
00035 #include <cmath>
00036 #include "vec3.h"
00037 #include "cxxutils.h"
00038 
00039 /*! \defgroup pointinggroup Pointings */
00040 /*! \{ */
00041 
00042 /*! Class representing a direction in 3D space or a location on the
00043     unit sphere. All angles in radians. */
00044 class pointing
00045   {
00046   public:
00047     /*! Colatitude of the pointing (i.e. the North pole is at \a theta=0). */
00048     double theta;
00049     /*! Longitude of the pointing. */
00050     double phi;
00051 
00052     /*! Default constructor. \a theta and \a phi are not initialized. */
00053     pointing() {}
00054     /*! Creates a pointing with \a Theta and \a Phi. */
00055     pointing (double Theta, double Phi) : theta(Theta), phi(Phi) {}
00056 
00057 // FIXME: should become "explicit" some time
00058     /*! Creates a pointing from the vector \a inp. \a inp need not be
00059         normalized. */
00060     pointing (const vec3 &inp)
00061       { from_vec3(inp); }
00062 // FIXME: should be removed some time
00063     /*! Returns a normalized vector pointing in the same direction. */
00064     operator vec3() const
00065       { return to_vec3(); }
00066     /*! Returns a normalized vector pointing in the same direction. */
00067     vec3 to_vec3() const
00068       {
00069       double st=sin(theta);
00070       return vec3 (st*cos(phi), st*sin(phi), cos(theta));
00071       }
00072     /*! Converts \a inp to \a ptg. \a inp need not be normalized. */
00073     void from_vec3 (const vec3 &inp)
00074       {
00075       using namespace std;
00076       const double twopi_=6.283185307179586476925286766559005768394;
00077       theta = atan2(sqrt(inp.x*inp.x+inp.y*inp.y),inp.z);
00078       phi = safe_atan2 (inp.y,inp.x);
00079       if (phi<0.) phi += twopi_;
00080       }
00081     /*! Changes the angles so that \a 0<=theta<=pi and \a 0<=phi<2*pi. */
00082     void normalize()
00083       {
00084       const double pi_=3.141592653589793238462643383279502884197;
00085       const double twopi_=6.283185307179586476925286766559005768394;
00086       theta=fmodulo(theta,twopi_);
00087       if (theta>pi_)
00088         {
00089         phi+=pi_;
00090         theta=twopi_-theta;
00091         }
00092       phi=fmodulo(phi,twopi_);
00093       }
00094   };
00095 
00096 /*! Writes \a p to \a os.
00097     \relates pointing */
00098 inline std::ostream &operator<< (std::ostream &os, const pointing &p)
00099   {
00100   os << p.theta << ", " << p.phi << std::endl;
00101   return os;
00102   }
00103 
00104 /*! \} */
00105 
00106 #endif
